column1: length and into the pads first up, no swing. Tucked with the angle to fine leg
good shot. Hint of swing on this. Full and coming in from middle stump. Rahul gets the front leg across, but manages to adjust and flick this behind square
good leave. Back of a length and slight shape in again. This time in the corridor
136 kph, good length, pushed across the batsman. Left alone
overpitched on middle stump. Not fully behind the line on this as he tries to flick with hard hands. Gets it off the inside half of the bat, fine leg cleans up to his left
good length, climbs from a middle stump line, jags in to strike the thigh guard as he looks to glance
short ball, angled in at the batsman who rises on top of the bounce and drops the ball into the leg side
leaves this short one alone - it's angled down leg side
back of a length, lifts from an off stump line and hits him in the thigh guard
back of a length outside off stump, nips back in and forces a dive left from Dickwella as Rahul lets it go
140 kph. First ball above 135 for him this morning. Good length and wide outside off, left alone
stuck on the pad as he looks to flick off the back foot. The appeal is turned down. This pitched on off, came back in, but there was an inside edge
back of a length, swinging away from outside off stump, left alone
back of a length and swinging away from outside off, left alone
140 kph, back of a length, wide of off, left alone
good length, nips away after pitching outside off, no shot offered
outside edge lands in front of the slip cordon and sneaks through between second and third. Finally gets one close to the batsman. Makes him drive at this off stump delivery and gets it to move late
oh and he attacks the inside edge next ball. Bends this back in at a good length. Dhawan hurriedly gets the bat down and pushes it to mid-on off the inside half
low full toss outside off stump, gets low with an opened face and taps this into the turf. Bounces over gully and races to the fence
back of a length, angled into off stump. Defended into the pitch
good length and outside off, nips back in a long way as he lets it go. Lands in front of Dickwella who can only parry it to his left
short and wide, 141 kph, cut for four. Easy runs on the first morning.
short and slanted across the left-hander. Mistimed cut this time. More of a back foot push, away from the body. Beats extra cover's throw
yorker outside off. Watchfully tapped in front of the slip cordon with soft hands
good length at leg stump, nicely balanced on the back foot as he whips this to square leg
full outside off stump, solidly pushed to mid-off off the front foot
inside edge onto pad. Gets cramped after picking the line early. Back of a length delivery outside off, cuts back in off the pitch
full, swinging, down leg and past the flick
good length outside off. Hard hands from Rahul as he looks to defend. Thick inside edge to square leg
another inside edge. Back of a length, slanted across off stump. Pokes at it without feet. Square leg in business again
and he continues to stray short and wide. Slapped on the up, in front of square
short and wide, tapped away off the back foot. Slow outfield allows the third as point gives chase
gets one off the middle. And gets it gorgeously. Full and angled in towards leg. Stands firm, offers the full face and drives it past mid-on
short ball at middle stump. Rahul is under it as he looks to hook. So he's not in full control. But he gets it wide of fine leg
well left. Short ball angled into the corridor, would have been awkward to fend at that

mix-up but not a dangerous one. Good length ball takes the inside edge as he defends off the front foot. Rolls away to the bowler's left and Rahul pauses after calling for the run before going through
back of a length, angled across the batsman who is on his toes as he turns this into the leg side with a close face
catches him on the back foot in front of middle and appeals. But that's going above. Brings it back in sharply from a length, and Dhawan is late on the flick
good length and wide outside off, no need to play at that. So he doesn't.
back of a length at off stump. Looks to bunt it into the leg side for a single, but square leg far too quick
in his zone, overpitched and some swing away from outside off. No feet. But he goes through with the drive and gets it low on the bat through the open extra cover area
back of a length at leg stump, nonchalantly pushed to wide mid-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
good length outside off, teasing movement away, left alone
good length and into the pads, whipped to long leg
back of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length outside off, defended with an open face
back of a length at off stump, nicely timed punch, straight to short extra cover
short and wide, nicely timed cut. Straight to deep-ish point
too easy for Dhawan. He's counting the number of cut shots they're offering him. This one is chopped past that point fielder
back of a length, angled in at off stump this time. Glanced to deep square
back of a length outside off, back foot punch straight to mid-off
good length, pitches on off stump, angles away. Left alone
full outside off. Wants to push this wide of mid-off, but he doesn't time it well enough
full and swinging into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
oh good ball! At long last for Sri Lanka. Good length, angles in harmlessly at off stump. Then spits at the batsman as it straightens to beat the outside edge
length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length, shaping away from the batsman who wants to pummel this through the covers. Inside edge to mid-on
good length outside off stump, opens the face and gets this to sneak from under second slip's lazy attempt
good length, angled in at off stump. Pushed into the point region with soft hands and no feet
short and angled across off stump. Angled-bat poke away from the body. Thick inside edge into the leg side
back of a length, across off stump. Pushes away from the body again. Thick inside edge past midwicket
short ball at the chest, pulled nicely, but there's deep square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
shot. Back of a length and away. After all the anxious pokes, he gets one off the middle. Doesn't run hard though. It's a slow outfield and this stops well short of the cover boundary
good length outside off, easily pushed into the covers for the single
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off, thick outside edge to third slip as he defends off the back foot
dropped! A difficult chance at mid-on. Kumara running backwards, has to put in a dive after picking this late. Rahul wants to loft this full ball through midwicket, but gets it off the bottom.
full and wide outside off, toe-ended drive through the covers
full outside off, firm cover drive, straight to extra cover
shot. Overpitched at leg stump. Drilled through square leg
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot. He's overstepped first ball
good length at leg stump, down the track, shovelled to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
full at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
well bowled. Gets it to dip and drop short of him as he steps out to try and drive through the covers. Inside edge, pad, back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
full and into the pads. Closes the face too early on the flick, gets a leading edge into the covers
full and into leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
good length, off stump. Defended off the front foot
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump. Whipped of middle stump to mid-on's left...and he lets it roll under his slide to give them the extra run. Chandimal there
nice shot. Length ball at off stump from around the wicket. Doesn't give it room to spin. Down the track, controlled loft over mid-off
back of a length at leg stump, can't get the flick past short leg
good length, angled in at middle stump. Tucked to midwicket off the front foot
poor bowling. Short and into middle stump. Back in the crease, front leg out of the way, swiped to the midwicket boundary
full and down leg side, flicked to deep square leg
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full at leg stump. Pushed to mid-on with soft hands
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
good length, slight movement away from off stump. Uses it to get a single to deep point with an open face
good length outside off, pushed to deep point off the front foot
short and wide outside off stump. Cut into the turf, straight to short cover
overpitched outside off stump. Driven to deep point's left
good length outside off stump, pushed to point on the up
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, jumps down the track, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
full and wide outside off, driven to the cover boundary. Nicely timed
back of a length outside off, pushed through point off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor. Inside edge as he looks to punch through the covers
he's having a bad time, Kumara. Not Dhawan. Dispatches this overpitched ball outside off. Driven to the cover boundary to bring up his fifty
full at off stump, driven firmly to extra cover...and a bit of the outside edge comes out with that shot
good length at off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length at leg stump, tickled to fine leg's right
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot

beaten in flight. Good length at middle stump. Down the track and can't get to the pitch. Looks to flick but this brushes the pad and forces Dickwella to dive to his left. He does well down the leg side
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square leg
good length, off stump. Skips down the track, pushes it back to the bowler
good length at off stump, jumps down to reach the pitch, drives to long-off
low full toss at off stump, tapped to mid-off
144kph, back of a length in the corridor, jams out a back foot defence
back of a length in the corridor. Poked into the point region with soft hands
full at middle stump, pushed wide of mid-on to bring up his seventh consecutive Test fifty
bouncer at off stump. Nicely on top of the bounce to hook this into the ground. Finds deep square leg
short and wide, chopped to deep point
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square leg
good length outside off stump, big stride to sweep this to long leg
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, tucked to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
good length in the corridor, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
overpitched outside off, driven straight to short cover
short and down leg side, left alone
overpitched outside off, thick inside edge on the attempted cover drive. Straight to mid-on
good length at middle stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, cramped on the cut, drags it to extra cover
good length outside off, pushed to point with an open face
good length outside off, defended down the pitch off the front foot
back of a length, pushed through straight outside off, defended off the outside half
good length outside off, defends off the back foot
short at off stump, punched to sweeper cover
full at off stump, driven to cover
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
good length at leg stump, flicked to long leg
good length at middle stump, tucked against the turn to long leg
good length at leg stump, pushed to long-on
good length outside off, front foot push with hard hands. Inside edge
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, driven to short mid-on
good length at middle stump, slides through and hits the outside half of the bat as he defends
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, quickly back in the crease to punch this past cover
good length at middle stump. Forward defence
short and wide, makes too much room for the cut, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to backward point off the back foot
full toss. Middle stump. Flays across the line to the square leg boundary
full outside off stump, kicks it away
good length at middle stump, pushed to long-on
full at leg stump, midwicket dives to his left to stop this flick
back of a length at leg stump, glanced to long leg
short and outside off stump. Deep in the crease, straight bat, punched through cover
oh lovely. Tossed up outside off and reaches the pitch to bludgeon this wide of mid-off
good length at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
oh hello. Pitches on off stump and spins a long way. Dhawan can't realistically get bat on that
back of a length at off stump, straight through this time. Punched to sweeper cover

chance at first slip, but Mathews can't get a hand on it. This short ball slid past off stump. Went for the cut and it flew really quickly to Mathews' left. His hands were moving right, expecting a thicker edge
good length at middle stump, forward defence
back of a length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up at leg stump. Looks for the flick, bat turns in his hand and he hits straight to midwicket
angled in full at off stump. No feet movement from Dhawan. Huge gap between bat and pad as he pushes it back at the bowler
good length, angled in at off stump, pushed to deep point with an open face
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to deep point
short and wide outside off stump, slashes at it, beaten
good length outside off, left alone
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
full at leg stump, down the track, driven to long-on
good length outside off, looks to sweep, beaten
good length outside off, pads it away
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square
good length at leg stump, taps it towards square leg. Short leg dives to his right, fields on the bounce and shies at the stumps. Good work, but it's a single, overthrows
back of a length and angled away, back and across, hits through the line, finds the extra cover boundary
good length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
good length at leg stump, tapped to wide mid-on
overpitched at off stump, jammed out to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, spins away and beats the outside edge. Loose, aimless push by Dhawan off the back foot
ouch. Good length outside off, connects the sweep nicely and catches short leg in the knee. Thanks goodness for those big pads under the trousers
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length at leg stump, spins past the edge down leg side
short outside off, back foot punch straight to extra cover
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length outside off, front leg goes forward as a formality. This shot is all hands -  speedy, strong hands. Slashed on the up and the deep fielder has no chance
back of a length in the corridor, taps it cover off the back foot and steals a single
good length, slanting away from the batsman, defended with an angled bat
nicely bowled. Drops this a tad short of length, with the same angle across. This one climbs as he fishes away from the body, past the outside edge
back of a length, middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, driven on the up to short extra cover
short, middle stump, slow. Back in the crease, hammered to the midwicket boundary
good shot. Full and spinning away from outside off. Reaches well outside and controls it to get it to the midwicket boundary
wrong'un. Back of a length at off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off, back foot punch to extra cover
short, outside leg, spins down further
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off stump, gets into the cut early, off the bottom of the bat to cover
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide, under-edge on the cut, keeper leaps to catch that
short and outside off stump, pulls, off the toe-end to mid-on
short and in the corridor. That's enough width for him. Slices it fine of deep point
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the sweep. Keeper can't catch it either
wrong'un, back of a length into off stump. Chopped to backward point
wrong'un goes so wrong. Full, pitches outside leg, spins past the keeper and takes a feather on the sweep
wrong'un, good length outside off stump. Keeps low, tapped to extra cover
short on middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
yorker at off stump. Walks across and tickles it to deep midwicket
good length, angled in at off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, tailing into the pad. Still head as he flicks this through midwicket, nicely timed
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
good length at leg stump, tapped to long leg off the back foot
full outside off, under-edges the drive. Bump ball to first slip's left
back of a length at off stump, punched to wide long-on
full outside off, driven to mid-off's left
full outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover's left. They don't capitalise on his fumble
wrong'un. But too short for trouble. Rahul was looking to sweep, but had time to go on the back foot to defend. Thick outside edge straight to slip on the bounce
good length outside off, driven on the up to short extra
good shot, but nicely fielded. Cover drive, straight from the sweet spot. Short extra dives and gets a hand to his right
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's right
bouncer at middle stump and Dhawan...I don't know really. It's a hybrid. Part-hook, part-pull, part-limbo. Straight to deep square
full at leg stump, gloriously driven, straight to mid-on
good length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, expansive punch to long-on off the back foot
good length, angled in at off stump. Defended off the back foot

straight to mid-on! It's one way to get Rahul. He will always take on a flighted delivery. That's what this is. Tossed up, good length at off stump. Steps out and gets too far away from it. Looks to lift it over mid-on, but drags it flat and to his left. Nicely held on. Another good knock Rahul knock ends without him getting to a 100
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
good length at off stump, forward block
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
short and wide, chopped to deep point off the under edge
full and down leg side. Watches it onto the bat and flicks it to fine leg's left. Slow outfield means only two
good length, in at off stump from wide of the crease, forward defence
short and into off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, thuds into the bat as he defends off the back foot
struck on the helmet. He's okay. Bouncer in the corridor. He's in two minds about this. Decides to leave at the last moment, but he's already in line. Strikes him flush in the front of the helmet
good length outside off, defended into the off side
there it is. Doesn't bother to run. Sixth hundred for Dhawan. Down the track, meets it at a good length outside off, drills it wide of mid-off
good length at middle stump, down the track, pushed to midwicket
short and wide outside off, easily punched off the back foot. No one deep at covers
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
tossed up at off stump, down the track, driven to long-on
good length outside off, guides it to deep point on the up
back of a length at middle stump, angled bat defence. Leading edge to mid-off
good length, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length at leg stump, glanced to square leg
short and in the corridor, back foot defence
good length at off stump, nicely forward to block it
good length at off stump, down the track, pushed to mid-off
good length, down leg side. Looks to paddle it. Misses. As does the keeper
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right. But the dive stops the runs
good length, arm ball. Into leg stump, pushed to short midwicket
short ball down leg side. Looks to pull but loses his balance. Falling backwards. Hits the pad and then the bat in it's follow-through. Lands in the off side. Could have easily landed on the stumps
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to the bowler
good length outside off, pushed to deep point with soft hands and he comes back for the second
yawn. Short, off stump. Gets under it, slices to the deep midwicket fence
oh dangerous. Walks across to expose middle and leg. Gets a yorker and just about manages to flick to long leg
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on
bouncer, too short, too far down leg side
good length outside off, left alone
good length at leg stump, looks to sweep, cops it on the pad
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tossed up at leg stump, down the track, pushed straight to mid-on
good length, pushed through. Looks to whip it, beaten. Through his legs
good length at leg stump, tapped to short leg on the bounce
good length at leg stump, down the track and pushes it wide of mid-on who slips and misses the opportunity for a possible run-out
good length outside off. Conventional legspinner, but it gets the outside edge as he pushes at it. Doesn't carry to slip's right
back of a length at off stump, pushed to cover point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length at middle stump, down the track, flicked to deep square
good length at off stump, forward defence
wrong'un. Back of a length at middle stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot

what a catch! Chadimal has plucked one to his left at square leg. Good length at middle stump. Nails the sweep shot, right off the middle. Chandimal goes two-handed, very very quickly to his left, and holds on
full at leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length at leg stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover
full outside off, driven to extra cover
good length, leg stump, whipped to square leg off the back foot
wrong'un, back of a length at off stump. Punched to sweeper cover
good length, middle stump, pushed to short leg off the front foot
wrong'un, tossed up outside off. Beaten on the cover drive, but Dickwella doesn't gather
back of a length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
good length at middle stump, slight extra bounce on that as he defends. But the hands are soft enough for that inside edge to land in front of short leg
good length, into leg stump. Forward defence
tossed up at middle stump, waits for it to land and punches forcefully past the non-striker
good length at leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
full at middle stump, driven inside-out to extra cover
good length at off stump, pushes it wide of extra cover off the front foot
good length and drifted down leg, steps out and pushes to midwicket who is halfway in from the boundary

outside edge, straight to slip. Short ball in the corridor. Pujara perhaps gets too far away from this as he looks to cut. It's a weak cut in the end. Comfortable height for Mathews, and at a gentle pace too. It was off the keeper's glove. Adjusted his hands nicely for the deviation
wrong'un. Good length at middle stump. Picks it and defends into the off side
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-off
good length, down leg side. Good take from Dickwella
good length, leg stump. Struck on the pad as he pushes forward, pitched and hit outside leg
good length, leg stump. Spins past the inside edge as he looks to defend. Another good take
back of a length at off stump, opens the face to guide it to deep point
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
short and wide. Offers the bait. Kohli lets it go
back of a length, off stump. Defended to mid-on
short and wide outside off, dies after pitching, doesn't carry after Kohli leaves
full at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length at leg stump, defends in front of his pad, inside half
good length at middle stump, inside edge onto pad
beaten. No idea where that was going. Wrong'un. Good length at off stump. Goes deep in the crease and is beaten on the outside edge
pushed through flat, length at middle stump, hurriedly defended back down the pitch
good length at middle, pushed straight to mid-on, but he gets a single
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to square leg
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and gets the back foot defence to gully
short and wide, left alone
back of a length, slanting across the corridor. Leaps off the ground to defend it, and chops it onto his toe
short and wide, nicely timed late cut. Races away to deep point's left but a one-handed dive and pick up keeps it to two
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length outside off, leans in and pushes it past extra cover
good length at leg stump, forward defence
beaten again. Wrong'un again. Back in the crease but not across. Poking away from the body and this spins past the outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, tucks off his chest to square leg
short and angled away from Kohli, close enough for the cut but left alone
pokes at one in the corridor. Length ball, outside edge, one-handed dive at gully
short and wide, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length, pushed across the batsman who, once more, will not take the bait. Left alone
good shot. Short and just outside off. Feet move quickly to make room, punched solidly past extra cover. Would have been four on most other outfields
short and wide outside off, punched again, straight to extra cover this time
overpitched outside off, a measured push past extra cover, allows him to pick up the second
good length at off stump, back foot defence
full outside off stump, forward defence
good length down leg side, tickles it fine off the thigh guard
good length at middle stump, flicks it and calls no, but square leg can't stop that to his right
good length, pushed wide outside off, left alone
chases one finally, and it's glorious when he gets it. Good length, angling away, but he gets the stride out and stays so balanced. On the up, through the covers
full outside off, driven again, straight to extra cover
full and angled away, left alone this time
good length, slanted away, left alone
wrong'un. Picked. Pushed to deep point off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, misses the flick, into the pads
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, driven off the back foot. Slightly skewed. To square leg
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
short and too wide, left alone
short and wide, slight swing away, left alone
pokes the wide, short one, out to deep point
good length at off stump, solid forward block into the covers
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
good length, cuts away in the corridor, left alone
good length at middle stump, defended back down the pitch
tossed up at leg stump, forward defence
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips through square leg
good length outside off, spins back in sharply, defended off the back foot
back of  length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, back foot defence
full and into off stump, driven on the up to mid-on
wow. Full outside off and he leans in, strong core, and is so still as he meets the ball at the pitch and drives past mid-off
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
good length at off stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
full, pitches on leg, spins further down

good length outside off, spins back in and strikes him in front of off stump. Big appeal is turned down. Possibly for height. They've reviewed. It hit him in line and spun back a long way. Could be going above. Yes, it is. Also spinning past leg stump. Good decision.
might not have picked that wrong'un, but it was so short, Rahane could still pull this to the midwicket boundary
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, forward defence
nearly loses off stump. Good length outside off, takes it on with the sweep and misses. It didn't turn enough for Sandakan
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, forward defence
full at leg stump, drives inside-out to long-off
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at middle stump, forward block
good length at off stump, forward defence. Rahane wants to run, Kohli doesn't. To their credits, both were firm in those decisions. No run out
length outside off, forward defence
wrong'un, good length. Off stump. Picks it, pushes it to extra cover
good length at middle stump, flicked to short fine
full at leg stump, pushed to midwicket
not picking it, Rahane. Good length at off stump. Thinks it's a wrong'un, looks to drive through extra cover. Thick inside edge rolls back to the bowler
full at leg stump, neatly tucked past midwicket off the front foot
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
goof length at off stump, forward defence

another for Pushpakumara! Rahane is done by the straight ball this time. This isn't deception, though, it's nerves. He's been so circumspect. Walks into this dipping ball on off stump. Brings the bat down at an angle - from third man's direction. Perhaps expecting it to turn. Even in that case, it would have been a poor shot. Not to the pitch. This also keep a tad low and slides through between bat and pad, straight up middle stump
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on
full at off stump, tapped to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to sweeper cover off the back foot
wrong'un, back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover's right
full and drifted into leg stump, driven to mid-on's right
good length, in at middle stump. Keeps low. Defended off the front foot
length, drifted in. Pokes at it, inside half of the bat
back of a length at middle stump, punched to short extra cover
good length at leg stump, steps down, beaten in flight. Pushes it to mid-on
good length outside off, stretches his arms and drives to extra cover. Didn't get to the pitch of that one
short and slightly wide, nicely timed late cut, straight to deep point
overpitched outside off, gets to the pitch and drives beautifully through the covers
full and down leg side, misses the paddle sweep
good length at off stump, pushed off the back foot. Wrong'un, picked off the pitch
full outside off stump, forward defence
back of a length at off stump, pushed through the covers off the back foot
full outside off, defended to extra cover
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length at leg stump, whipped wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
back of a length at leg stump, glanced off the hips...slips at the non-strikers end
bouncer, too short, easily ducked
good length outside off, pushed through the covers off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
full and into leg stump. Hurriedly flicked into that nexus of catching midwickets. Along the floor though
good length, into leg stump. Flicked off the back foot to square leg
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, forward defence
tossed up at off stump, driven to short cover-point
good length at leg stump, pushes in front of the pads, back down the pitch
overpitched at leg stump, flicked into short leg's shin
full, swinging in late. But controlled flick to deep square
back of a length in the corridor, pushed into the off side, away from the body
inswinging yorker. Well, an attempted yorker. It's a full toss, driven straight to mid-off
short in the corridor, gets the bat out of the way and lets it go
inswinger, good length at leg stump. Pushed on the up to mid-on
good length, down leg side
full at middle stump, inside-out drive, long-off
good length, drifts in at off stump, beats him in flight, then beats his outside edge. Beauty
full at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
good length at off stump, forward defence
risky shot but well executed in the end. It's good length, sliding on, but he chooses to go on the back foot. Chops it just in time and gets two
good length at off stump, forward defence
full at leg stump, flicked past square leg off the inside half
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length at leg stump, flicked to square leg
full at middle stump, drives against the turn to mid-off
good length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to deep point
full at middle stump, steps down the track and flicks nicely through the open midwicket region
back of a length outside off stump, exposes his stumps as he chops this, straight to backward point
good length outside off, arm ball. Pushes away from the body, inside edge
full at leg stump, pushed wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover
good length at off stump, skewed drive off the outside half, didn't get to the pitch
full at off stump, driven to deep extra cover
good length at off stump, forward defence
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
wrong'un. Picked. Left alone
another wrong'un. Piks it again, goes after it. Chops it past slip
good length at leg stump, raps him on the pad as he looks to flick
good length at off stump, forward defence off the inside half
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover
short and coming in. Once again, Ashwin exposes his stumps to cut. Straight to point
full at off stump, driven to deepish extra cover
good length outside off. Looks to drive, but not to the pitch. Thick outside edge races past backward point
full at off stump, driven to long-off
full at leg stump, flicked to square leg

slip holds on to an easy one! He'd been reaching out and failing to get to the pitch for a while now - it leads to his wicket. This was good length outside off. Playing too far away from the body. Healthy edge, regulation catch
full outside off, looks to drive, beaten. Loud appeal from Dickwella. Not out. Reviewed. Likely bat hitting the ground...looks like that on the first replay too.Yep. Decision stands.
wrong'un. Pitches short at middle stump. Saha breathes in relief because that has turned too much. He hadn't picked it
good length at middle stump, pushed to short leg off the back foot
full toss at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at off stump. Steps out, pushes to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot
length at off stump, blocked off the front foot
good length outside off, tapped through the covers off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, yorks himself, pushed back to the bowler
wrong'un, not picked. Short and wide, though. Reaches for it, gets it through the covers
full at leg stump, gets low and dabs it fine on the full
short wrong'un again, enough time to adjust. Punches to extra cover, who misfields
back of a length outside off, chopped to deep point
full and into the pads. Tickels it past short leg. Saha takes off at the non-strikers, but Ashwin doesn't so much as look at him. Dickwella fumbles, all is good
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, pushed to deep point off the front foot
ankle height zinger raps him in front of leg stump. Going down leg though as he looked to whip this
tossed up at a length on middle stump, drives without feet, thick outside edge wide of mid-on
full at off stump, driven firmly to extra cover
full outside leg stump, bunts it with a paddle sweep, straight to short fine
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to short fine off the back foot
good length, middle stump. Pushed to midwicket off the back foot
tossed up at middle stump. Doesn't allow it to pitch. Sweeps  along the turf to deep square
back of a length outside off, sliced past that gully, to deep point
full outside off, driven to extra cover
good length outside off, pushed on the up to extra cover
good length at middle stump, bounces a touch, takes the shoulder of the bat as he defends
full at middle stump, defended to short extra
close call. Bat and pad jammed together as he pushes forward. Struck in line too, but the umpire obviously believes that was bat first...and he's right
full outside off, driven to deep extra cover
full at off stump, forward defence
back of a length, swinging in at middle stump, hurried back foot defence
back of a length at the pads, flicked fine, no chance for the deep fielder
good length, shaping in at middle stump. Forward defence

good length at middle stump, looked like an inside edge onto pad, lbw appeal turned down...oh but he has reviewed it. Bizzare, really. Inside edge, pitching outside, hitting outside. The bowler said yes, Chandimal said okay.
back of a length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off
good length, leg stump, inside edge, off the pad as he looks to flick. Fine leg cleans up
good length at leg stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, forward block
length at off stump, pushed into the off side
good length, comes in with the arm and takes the inside edge as he pokes at it. Rolls to short fine
good length at off stump, defends solidly with soft hands
good length at off stump, forward block
full toss outside off, opens the face to run it to deep point
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
full toss outside off stump, guided to deep point
good length at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length at off stump, looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge through midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, defended to backward point
back of a length, climbing in the corridor. Saha takes the bait, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, thick outside edge into the slip cordon
good length at leg stump, pushed through midwicket on the up
good length at leg stump, squeezes it to fine leg with a turning bat
full and wide, left alone

great catch! Back of a length, slanting away from the right hander. One finally pokes at it, and gets the outside edge. Sri Lanka's slip cordon starts with second slip. It's because Dickwella can dive the way he just has. One-handed, to his right, and taken in front of second slip
awkward from Saha. Looks to duck this short ball, before realising it's not climbing at all. He's crouching as it heads for his chest. Gets the bat up and somehow, it lobs over third slip
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and pokes to deep point
bouncer at the chest. Defended off the glove. Nicely done in the end. Dropped it short of a deep short leg fielder
back of a length in the corridor, tentative prod away from the body, to gully
short ball in the corridor, Pandya leaping in a hurry to defend this. Might have copped another one in the glove
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to short leg off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, watchfully defended into the leg side
good length at leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
good length, swinging down leg side, past the flick
good length outside off stump, chases one he shouldn't be chasing. Looks to drive on the up, bat turns, ball dribbles through mid-off
good length at off stump, leans into it, watches it onto the bat, and takes the bottom hand off as it strikes the bat
well left. Pushes it across the corridor to try and get that edge. Saha is having none of it. Lets it go
good intent from Pandya to start. Strides forward and drives through cover. Sets off and sprints back for the second.
prodigious movement. 86 mph, good length outside off, serves back in and keeps moving away from Dickwella's left. Moved after leaving the bat
inward seam movement, defended away towards mid-on
goes full, and straight. A thick inside edge through backward square leg for a single. Seems hurried for pace this morning does Pandya.
87 mph, overpitched just outside off. Saha inside-edges into his pad. Clear indication of the ball seaming back in
back of a length down leg, nudged down to fine leg for one. Tidy start from Kumara, still eight off it.
a loosener, in terms of pace. 130 kph. Full outside off, Saha gets forward and defends into his pad
shortish and wide, Saha stays in his crease and punches gracefully through extra cover for a couple. The deep point is more towards deep backward point, so plenty of ground to cover

Saha finds gully. Not the greatest ball, but they don't care. Good length delivery outside off, Saha looks to use the pace on the ball and deflect it past gully. But he can't keep it down nor find the gap. Dilruwan takes a sharp catch at gully, to his right. The fielder may have been just a touch forward to cut off the angle. That would have meant that if the ball came to him, it would be at a decent pace, but Vishwa's medium pace ensured it wasn't as tough a catch as it should have been.

yikes, that's awful shot selection. Full outside off, Kuldeep gets his pad right outside off and looks to tuck that through square leg. Struck on the pad just outside off. Actually, Kuldeep seems to have hit his pad. The ball went straight through
much better, and gets runs for it. Full and straight, pushed away through mid-on for a couple runs
nice end. Back of a length outside off, Kuldeep thinks of flirting, but decides against it, with time to spare
a well-directed bouncer, on middle and leg, aimed at the badge. Beats Pandya's pull for pace
well done from Pandya. Back of a length on off, this bouncer doesn't have much pace. Pandya gets underneath the length and ramps that over the keeper.
on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
143 kph, on a length and straight, blocked to mid-on
good single. Tucks this through midwicket for a run.
139 kph, aiming for a cut to that deep point. But the ball seams back in towards off, Pandya awkwardly keeps it out.
134 kph, good length outside off, left alone
another leave outside off. Tidy channel from Vishwa.
fullish delivery outside off, Kuldeep bails out of his stroke late
129 kph, deflects a good-length delivery to the deep point fielder. Played it discernibly late
83 mph, good length outside off, pushed to cover. Generating a nice angle from over the wicket

132 kph, a big noise, but it may have been pad. Good length outside off, gets this to jag back in and cut Pandya in half. An appeal, but umpire Tucker says no. Pushing deliveries away for a bit, but then gets one to nip back
defended away to cover. A long run, but Kuldeep says no
back of a length on leg, nudged to fine leg
139 kph, smashed away. A touch too short, but that's plenty of width. Pandya hammers that through cover. Again, the fielder has too much distance to cover, so that runs away despite the slow outfield
good length outside off, guided to gully. Good option from Pandya
137 kph, fuller than a good length and straight. Pandya keeps that out
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off. Pandya disgusted with the result of his shot
too wide outside off, but there is some away shape. Left alone
good length outside off, moves away. Kuldeep says nah, thanks. Left.
better line. 133 kph, on a length, towards the fifth-stump channel. Dabbed to gully.
full outside off, a thick outside edge dies and trickles to gully
well bowled. Gentle away shape outside off, left alone
steals the maiden from Vishwa with a well-timed drive through cover for one
well bowled. A pacey bouncer aimed at the badge. Kuldeep hurries underneath
142 kph, the 1-2 from Kumara. Follows a good bouncer with a length delivery well outside off. Kuldeep can't help himself from flirting and getting beaten on the outside edge
full delivery outside off, 141 kph, defended to mid-off
another bouncer, this isn't too well directed. Kuldeep's eyes aren't on the ball but he avoids that well enough
full delivery outside off, 132 kph, defended to mid-off
nicely strokes a carved drive through deep cover for a run. 'Ruk ja,' says Pandya (stop)
good length outside off, pushed away to mid-off. 89 mph
not great bowling. He's getting a little bit of movement, which is far more dangerous than deliveries that are swinging all over the place, but he ain't making Kuldeep play. An easy leave
makes him play and gets an edge. Good length outside off, Kuldeep gets a thick edge which falls well short but finds a gap between second and third slip. Should have been stopped at least?
full delivery outside off, 133 kph, pushed away to mid-off
lovely delivery this time. Good length outside off, holds its line and beats Kuldeep on the outside edge. Keep it there.
131 kph, a big appeal, but high. Another nice delivery, around off. Comes back in, beats Kuldeep on the inside edge, but not full enough. Missing the stumps, says HawkEye
great end. Full outside off, entices a drive from Kuldeep but the ball holds its line. Another one that beats the bat. Much better over
good length outside off, 116 kph. Pandya looks to bash that through cover, but the ball goes under the bat
full and wide, moving away, driven to cover
nicely bowled. Some dibbly-dobbly nothings can be dangerous too. Around off, defended
an easy single. Full and straight, defended to long-on. May have kept a little low
fullish and wide outside off, left alone. Shaped away
another good length delivery outside off that doesn't make Kuldeep play
lovely shot. Back of a length on middle, pummeled through midwicket for four. That lack of pace doesn't trouble Pandya
136 kph, around off, defended
fuller than a good length around off, worked through midwicket for a couple. Far too easy
punched, off the back foot, to mid-off
worked to deep square leg, 81 mph
goes wide of the crease, back of a length outside off. Kuldeep misses a waft
full and wide outside off, 115 kph, driven to cover with little trouble
nicely played this time. Moving away outside off, 70 mph, Kuldeep plays that late and guides it past gully for four. Slices that off the open face
defended to cover point. Another easy run
116 kph, full and straight. A defensive prod back to the bowler
114 kph, pushed to cover
136 kph, good length outside off, this ball has no movement. Kuldeep lets it go
good length outside off, 84 mph, blocked to gully off the open face
full delivery outside off, 130 kph, defended
81 mph, quite full outside off, pushed to mid-off
135 kph, back of a length outside off, left alone
134 kph, beats the bat again. Good length outside off, some movement leaves Kuldeep and his bat hanging
flight on the pads, worked to midwicket for a run
too much flight outside off, ends up full, nicely driven to the sweeper cover
80 kph, driven back to the bowler. That line needs to be a stump or two outside off
still straight, defended back
overly full outside off, hammered to long-off.

80 kph, the googly. His opposite left-arm wristspinner doesn't read it. Beats him on the inside edge and hits him in front, or just outside, off. No, says umpire Illingworth. A big inside edge onto pad anyway
back of a length on middle, hammered to deep square leg. Quick onto that stroke. A delectable stroke, but should have found the gap behind square.
134 kph, full on the pads. Kuldeep misses a flick, off the pad towards cover for a quick leg bye. Good awareness by Pandya
walks to the bowler and pushes a drive to the deep cover fielder. These two doing it too easily
digs this in, 132 kph outside off, Kuldeep takes his eyes off the ball but the ball evades comfortably
133 kph, not a bad delivery at all. Back of a length down leg, Kuldeep lifts his hands vertically to ensure the ball doesn't catch the glove
good length on off, comfortably defended
77 kph, overly full outside off, Pandya's straight punch skews away off the outside half to deep cover
ripping turn. The wristspinner's revs. Lovely to watch. Pitches on middle, spins away and beats the bat by a mile
flat down leg, misses Kuldeep's sweep. Dickwella takes off the bails a fraction of a second too late, his back foot was in the air for just a little bit
comes down the pitch but defends the legbreak well enough to cover
full and wide outside off, too full, goes underneath Kuldeep's sweep. Kuldeep, in trying to keep his back-foot balance, falls over, and Dickwella takes off the bails again
a quick straight delivery, a thick inside edge to deep backward square leg
another bouncer outside off, 136 kph. Don't mind this tactic. Kuldeep sways away uncomfortably
87 mph, full and straight, inside-halved away towards midwicket
on a length on middle, thick inside edge onto the body
back of a length on off, 133 kph, a slow surface means Kuldeep can get on his toes and watch the ball onto hos bat. Defended capably
spears in a low full toss on leg, clipped to deep square leg
a bouncer on off, Pandya rolls his wrists on that to pull to deep square leg. Argh, I would have wanted Kuldeep on strike to the wristspinner
overpitched on off, 49 mph, jammed away to cover
nudged away to midwicket for a run
a quick flat delivery outside off, Kuldeep chooses to leave
a tossed up legbreak outside off, defended to cover
80 kph, lovely stroke. Kuldeep runs down and drives with a straight bat towards mid-on. Beats the fielder but they get two after Pandya realises late that there is a chance
plenty of flight outside off, an under-edge past slip for three to third man. Runs coming far too easily for both batsmen now
plenty of flight down leg, a thick inside edge to fine leg
nice execution. Sees mid-on isn't back, so runs down and shovels a lofted drive over the fielder
tossed up on off, defended into the off side
shimmies down and drives to long-on
a slow leg-side delivery down leg, Kuldeep tries to reverse sweep but doesn't get close
a sweep beats leg slip, earns Kuldeep a run to fine leg
a googly outside off, Kuldeep goes back, reads Sandakan off the pitch, and pushes it back
quicker and fuller outside off, left alone
more flight outside off, Kuldeep gets forward to defend
another googly outside off, Kuldeep reads him off the hand, gets forward and smothers the spin
the legbreak outside off, Kuldeep defends off the back foot. Has played him really well this over
a slog sweep is poorly executed. Flat and wide outside off, Kuldeep flat-bats one to mid-on
calls for two and gets it easily. Well played. Flat and quick on middle, shovelled into the gap at midwicket
slow and wide outside off, defended into the off side. Sees Pandya coming, pulls the length back
the drifter, slides on with the arm on off, pushed to cover
comes down and drives to long-on. India get to 400. They've scored plenty this series
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
lots of loop and flight on that, played away to mid-on
the googly on middle, Pandya comes down to defend
on the pads this time, worked to short leg
the googly outside off, Pandya rocks back and punches to long-off
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
uses his feet to get as close to the ball as possible. Defended away awkwardly

after bowling too full, he drags the length back on this and gets a thick outside edge. Given, by umpire Illingworth. Kuldeep reviews inexplicably, but he has got a thick outside edge. A big spike on UltraEdge. Dickwella follows the ball and takes a good catch. That wicket is down to the length - left Kuldeep wondering whether to come forward or go back - and a little bit of spin - not too much to beat the edge
Pandya will look to attack now. Gets low and nails a sweep to deep midwicket. Takes the single
77 kph, drifts on with the arm, and beats the inside edge. Struck down leg
flat on off, dabbed towards point
driven away to cover
lots of flight outside off, driven upto long-off
clipped to deep backward square leg with a dance and a shimmy down. Just beats short leg. if he had collected it, that would have been a run-out.
comes down and drills a drive to long-off. Good fielding to keep them down to one
that's tripe. Short and wide outside off, so slow that Shami rocks back and slaps it through cover with ease. Poor ball
a googly outside off, sliced to deep point
clears long-on. Sandakan sees Pandya coming so fires a wide googly, but even though Pandya has far from middled that, he still clears long-on, who got around to his left
another googly on middle, thick outside edge towards third man. Slip runs after it, and Pandya comes back for two. Terrific running
another short and wide googly, this one beats Pandya's cut. A fifty was there
flat and straight, pushed back to the bowler
steps out and drills a drive to long-off. Shami very hands too
pushes this to long-off for a run and gets to his fifty. Brings out the 2-2 Dhawan celebration in jest.
flat and straight, quite full too. Blocked
that was close. Chandimal looks around and chooses not to review. That was definitely worth it, in my opinion. An inside edge actually. Flat and straight. Good call from Sri Lanka and umpire Tucker.
pushed away to the sweeper cover, another easy single for the No. 10
82 kph, outside off, under-edged to slip

and another one. Tossed up outside off, Shami looks to hit that through mid-off, but the ball takes the inside half of the bat and skews back to the bowler. Sandakan takes an easy reverse-cupped catch off his own bowling.
shortish and wide outside off, sliced away to deep point
a googly down leg, swept to deep backward square leg. Pandya refuses the run
that's why he refused it. Comes down and hits that googly with the spin over long-off. His power did the rest. Fantastic execution
a googly that is far too wide for Test match legality. Called
worked away to deep midwicket for one. That is the more easiest last-ball single I've seen
hammered for four through midwicket. Flat and straight, swept powerfully to deep midwicket. Great stroke
powered for four more. Hurtling across now. Runs down and smashes that past the bowler. Pushpakumara belatedly gets his hand close but the ball goes past easily. Four to long-off
4, 4, 6. Flight on off, Pandya comes down and lofts that easily over long-off. Just clean striking. These are big runs in the context of the game
4, 4, 6, 6. The benefits of T20 cricket. India get to 450. Shimmies down and hammers a flat six to long-off. Flat and straight. Sensational striking. Pushpakumara going over the wicket doesn't help
six more. Where has this guy been in Test cricket. Comes down and blitzes this over long-on. Fantastic hitting technique this
he has missed an easy flick through midwicket. Wow. A leg side delivery on the pads and somehow Pandya misses that. I'm willing to bet that may have been six if he wanted to go after that
good stop by cover. Tossed up outside off, drilled to cover's left
big bat-pad gap and the ball goes through. Full outside off, goes between that gap. Just one bye, even though it almost made the boundary
a wide? Sees Pandya coming and fires a googly well outside off. Wide called.
in the slot for the big hoick over midwicket. Meets it too early and toe-ends this back to the bowler
nicely bowled. Pandya lines up a massive slog, but bails out, defends away a googly.
well bowled. Sees Pandya coming and fires it wide outside off, left alone, he hurries back to the crease
flat on middle, hammered to deep midwicket for a single. That's just too easy.
back of a length on leg, defended. Wild cheers from the crowd. Pandya will be looking for those twos. A chance of a run-out

another six. Gets inside the line of this, gets underneath the bouncer and pulls over backward square leg. Moves to 90. Again, that's just tremendous hitting technique. T20 style cricket changing a Test match
fullish delivery on off, thick inside edge onto the pad
full delivery outside off, pushed to long-off. Still says no
good bowling. Sees Pandya moving across and bowls this on leg stump. Pandya though is in fine form, won't miss that flick to fine leg for one
a low full toss on leg, pushed to mid-on. Umesh's bat breaks, a big wide crack through the middle. Not quite the equipment Kumara was hoping to break. Something better than nothing, I suppose.
slow outside off, Pandya lets this one go.
a wide googly outside off, another wide.
another googly outside off, smashed to deep cover
another googly outside off, under-edged through the keeper's legs. Slip cleans up

that's way over midwicket. He was waiting for that, a ball in his slot. He gets low and hammers that easily over midwicket for six. A googly. He may or may not have picked that, but if it's that full, it's easy
just bunts a ball through extra cover and calls for two, gets it easy
80 kph, another wide. India upto 476. A googly that is far too wide outside off
flat and straight, looks for one to long-on, but Sandakan gets across to his right and stops the ball. Good stuff
143 kph, full and straight, pushed back to the bowler who parries it away. Umesh wants one, Pandya doesn't. There was no run there. Good stuff from Pandya
a yorker on middle and leg, kept out.
a short slow bouncer outside off that is watched away. Not a bad option, but awful execution. Have to make Umesh duck or sway
full and wide outside off, pushed away to point's right. Enough time for one
gets past and Pandya makes his first international century. Full and straight, pushed back towards mid-on, who dives valiantly to his left. The 2-2 celebration. What a fine effort this has been.
a good bouncer on leg, but Pandya stays underneath the length and ramps it over the keeper. This is simple batting, on the merit, but match-changing. Sri Lanka, it seems, have no answers or plans
tossed up outside off, driven back towards cover
the googly outside off, pitches outside off and beats the bat. Well bowled
flight outside off, defended away
another googly outside off beats the bat
75 kph, full and straight, defended. Good defensive technique
gets right forward to defend that. Well done Umesh Yadav. Used his long reach to smother the spin
125 kph, a bouncer on leg that is far too high for legality. Another extra
slower ball on off, 71 mph, defended
a low full toss is hit to long-off but Pandya's secure at the striker's end.
an offcutter outside off, Pandya picks this early and leaves. He moved his delivery position so early that I picked the offcutter before release
a short bouncer down leg, 81 mph. Pandya gets underneath that
an offcutter outside off, another leave
full outside off, blocked to cover for a run.
overpitched outside off, drilled to long-off
flat and wide outside off, Pandya doesn't change his batting stance at all

and taken. The first over after lunch. A googly outside off, Pandya looks to go over long-off, but the googly takes the ball away from the bat. Skewed off the outside half of the bat, sliced away to the deep cover fielder. That's a five-for for Sandakan, a fine effort from the left-arm wristspinner. The break has done for Pandya.
starts with a well-directed bouncer that forces Karunaratne to duck. Saha flies away to his right.
good length delivery, swerving back in. Defended, eyes on the ball, head over it
more movement. Inside-edged into the pad. Full outside off, but substantial in-shape
good length and very wide outside off, no trouble in leaving that
on the hips and Karunaratne flicks through backward square leg for a couple. Played that nicely
phew, good leave. Full delivery outside off, movement back in. Karunaratne leaves. Saha takes it low to his right.
good length outside off, left alone. 134 kph.
134 kph, good length outside off, pushed to cover for a run. A nice punch
far too wide outside off, even though the length is full. Left alone.
full outside off, better line and length with the new ball. Karunaratne drives to mid-off with the full face. Kohli dives to his left.
134 kph, one of the better shots of the day. Tharanga presses forward and just times the pants off his cover drive. No cover in place. Elegant, holds the pose too
wides, five. Full and very wide outside off, that was angled away actually. Bounces in front of Saha. Seen wider ones not called.
fantastic end. Fuller than good length on off, blocked back.
good length outside off, left alone
full and straight, nudged with the angle to square leg. Kuldeep misfields and allows one. Poor fielding

edged and taken! Tharanga nicks off. And reviews it. I'm not sure what's happening with these reviews, why would he chat with his partner and then review? It's another absolutely awful review. Shami gets this to come back in, but the key is that it didn't swing as much as the previous ones. Tharanga played for more swing than there was and got a thin edge. Saha dives away to his right and takes a good catch. But that's just awful cricket post the event from Tharanga. A terrible mis-use of the system, and should be held wholly accountable if a middle-order player gets a howler. A big noise too.
excellent use of the short ball, quick and straight. Mendis gets under that awkwardly
lovely. 144 kph, quick, and extra zip off the surface with the new ball. Another bouncer outside off, Mendis somehow avoids that, eyes off the ball.
back of a length on off, defended well enough this time
out with a direct hit? Mendis turned slowly. Good length outside off, defended to point. Karunaratne says 'no, no, no, no'. Mendis turns in a circle almost. A direct hit would have had Mendis.
off the pad to fine leg. Good length down leg, beaten for pace. There's some zip on this surface
ah, terrific shot. On a length but on the thigh, and Kusal says keep it there. Flicks through backward square leg with a nice deflection off his pads.
full and straight, the ball seams back in after pitching and hits Mendis in front of leg, but sliding down leg.
133 kph, too straight from Umesh. Mendis flicks away in front of midwicket this time. A slow outfield but great timing. Four more
movement. That's a better place to start if you're getting inswing. Slightly outside off, a thick inside edge into the body.
fullish delivery outside off, 145 kph. Keeps a tad low. Karunaratne defends. Nice length from Shami
comes back in. Good length around off, inside-edged into the body again.

terrific bowling this. Full again outside off, Karunaratne plays for some swing - like he has been doing through the innings - but this one doesn't move as much. So similar to the Tharanga dismissal. A thick outside edge and taken by Saha. Exceptional bowling. Not sure you can control the amount of swing you get, but he has done Karunaratne in with that length and plenty of doubt. At least, there's no review this time. They check the validity of the delivery - a legal front-foot delivery - and the catch - that's legal too, carried comfortably
there is that short delivery outside off, this is mis-directed. Way outside off, left alone

142 kph, terrific bowling. Fullish delivery around off, nips back in and hits Chandimal on the back thigh. An appeal is withdrawn. Just a touch high but closer than i initially thought. Over the stumps, says HawkEye
full delivery outside off, this one seams away. Chandimal defends

that's closer. Still a touch high? But Kohli reviews. Fuller than a good length on off, moves back in again, beats Chandimal on the inside edge and hits him on the back thigh. No bat. Umpire's call on height after two reds. Not a howler of a review. Another sensational over from Shami
good length outside off, moving away, 142 kph, carved to point. Umesh has to keep his line there, and let variable movement do its thing
full delivery outside off, defended
lovely bowling. Full delivery outside off - a set of stumps outside off - Mendis plays the line and is beaten by a mile. Actually, that's a good leave
good length outside off, defended to cover. Much better channel from Umesh, maybe a few inches fuller keeps Mendis' footwork indecisive
well bowled. Pushes Mendis back with a short ball, ducks
superb shot. On the pads after five good balls and Mendis flicks aerially, and safely over square leg.
full delivery outside off, left alone. Good leave
terrific bowling again. Full delivery, moving away late, a thick outside edge dies in front of Kohli at third slip. Good stop
full but far too wide, left alone, 137 kph
145 kph, full and straight, blocked
lovely stop from mid-off. Full and wide outside off, driven towards Pandya at mid-off, who sprints to his right to save four.
sublime lines. Making Chandimal play, full and straight, blocked
good length around off, 84 mph, looking for that top of off line. Blocked

that's not a bad ball, but Mendis' wrists take that through square leg. Full and straight, Mendis takes the risk of using as less of the bat as possible, as opposed to a straight bat. High risk, high reward
full and wide outside off, 136 kph, left alone
on the pads, clips to square leg.
136 kph, good length outside off, pushed to cover for a nice run.
around off at 134 kph, kept out.
good length on middle and off, 88 mph, flicked through square leg. Those wrists again
outside off on a length, defended towards point
superb shot but don't mind that Shami. Overpitched slightly outside off, a sublime straight drive with the full face through mid-off. Waited for one closer to him
drags his length back, good length outside off, defended to cover

what happened there? Firstly, that's terrific stuff from Ashwin. Full and straight on middle and leg, flicked to mid-on's left. Ashwin dives to his right, gets up and throws at the non-striker's end even though Mendis is halfway down. Chandimal, aware of the stop, sends his partner back too late. Mendis turns back to see Ashwin's throw miss the stumps at the non-striker's end. He thinks he's safe and labours back, but Kuldeep Yadav is backing up closely at short cover. Picks up and throws the stumps down at the bowler's end. Mendis is still short. In all this time, Shami has no idea what's going on after the throw evades him. There was a slip too from Mendis.
138 kph, good length delivery outside off, a hint of away seam movement and the ball beats the bat. Sensational bowling
full and straight, defended easily by Mathews.
attacking the stumps, full and straight, defended

and another one. 135 kph, this time from Pandya. Full and straight from the bowler, this one seams back in and beats Mathews' inside edge. That may or may not have been sliding down leg, but Mathews can't even consider reviewing because of Tharanga's review. He walks off. Just a little bit of seam movement doing for Sri Lanka. India have done well to make the batsmen play, the variable bounce and movement (off the pitch, off the seam or off the hand) is doing the rest. All reds on HawkEye.
full and straight, towards off, defended. No feet movement. India's spinners haven't been needed yet
nicely hit. Full and wide outside off, overpitched, and Dickwella lays into a crisp cover drive
full and straight, a thick inside edge into the pad.
back of a length outside off, dabbed backward of point for a late run. 'No' followed by 'yea'. Rahul throws at the batsman's end and concedes an overthrow
140 kph, full and close to off, Chandimal gets forward to prop a defensive stroke to point
good length outside off, left alone, 141 kph
full and wide outside off, driven to the left of mid-off for a quick single
another neat cover drive earns Dickwella three. No movement there. This should be Shami's last over of the spell too
143 kph, overpitched outside off, driven upto mid-off
strays down leg for an ODI wide
there is that hard length, a bouncer-ish delivery on off, Dickwella sways out of the line comfortably

did it pitch in line? No, says Rod Tucker. India don't bother reviewing. Full on leg, Dickwella misses a flick and is struck right in front. Two definite reds in a would-be HawkEye. Yes, pitched well outside leg
good length outside off, defended to point
drifts down leg again for another ODI wide
good length on off, defended to cover. Good over from Pandya
full outside off, no spin, defended
slow on middle, full again, inside-edged to short leg
looks for the sweep, pitched well outside ;leg, Chandimal misses a sweep and is struck on the pad, eliciting an optimistic appeal
flat down leg, swept away to the deep backward square leg boundary. I'd definitely have a deep backward square leg as a catching position even, a few feet in front of the boundary
pushed to mid-on for a quick single.
uses his feet this time, gets to the pitch and drives to wide mid-off for one.
comes down and drives to mid-off neatly
the sweep, well in front of square this time. Full enough to keep Ashwin interested of going under the bat, but clean connection
flat on off, drifts on with the arm, a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Well bowled
more Moeen Ali-type drift, flat outside off, moves on with the arm, defended to cover with bat and pad close together, defended to cover
fullish and straight, Dickwella goes back to something he should have been forward to. Awkwardly defended
a thick inside edge through square leg for a single.
the googly on middle and leg, Dickwella does not pick that, goes back to cut, chopped to point
just short of midwicket. Flight down leg, Dickwella runs down and flicks aerially
plenty of turn. Flat and wide outside off, sliced away towards point. Something always happening when wristspinners are bowling
quick on leg, 83 kph, pushed back to the bowler
does him in with an absolute gem. Chandimal did not read that at all, it was too full to read him off the pitch. The googly on off, beats him all ends up
another nice delivery. Quick on leg, awkwardly played into the off side
good length outside off, punched to deep point
full outside off, pushed away towards extra cover.
full delivery outside off, 132 kph, driven to a shortish cover
good length outside off, too wide to draw a stroke from Chandimal
nicely hit through extra cover. Good length outside off, crashed away through cover off the back foot. A slap
well bowled. Full and wide outside off, 136 kph. Chandimal looks for an exuberant drive through cover, no connection.
tossed up on off, defended to mid-off. 80 kph.
there is the first. Flight outside off, Dickwella gets low and creams his slog sweep over midwicket. Got underneath that enough
pushed to mid-off for a quick single. Good batting from Dickwella
a googly on leg, this is short enough for Chandimal to go back, read him off the pitch and defend
slowish and full on leg, defended
full outside off, spinning back in. Easily defended to mid-off
good length on middle and leg, shovelled towards midwicket for a quick single. Dickwella doing this nicely
good length on middle and leg, easily worked through square leg for a couple. Seems the ball has lost its zip as it has got older. Or Pandya's pace isn't as high as normal
good length outside off, left alone
138 kph, on a length outside off, defended towards cover
full around off, Chandimal plays the ball slightly early and the ball slices off the outside half to deep point
good length outside off, 135 kph, dabbed to point
that's a poor delivery and put away. Short and wide outside off, Chandimal goes back and hammers his slap through cover. Easy

four more. This is overly full outside off, Chandimal lets the ball come close before dishing out a well-timed drive through cover. Two bad lengths from Kuldeep to start - had to be somewhere in between
fullish and straight, played away into the leg side
too full again and four more. Overly full outside off, Chandimal laces another powerful drive through mid-off.
pushed away to mid-on
the googly, on middle, sliced to point
too straight from Pandya again, flicked through square leg for a couple. The fifty partnership between these two
good length on off, defended back
good length delivery outside off, defended away to deep point. Met the ball at the right time to get one
smashed over mid-on. Full on off, Dickwella stays in his crease and lifts the ball easily over mid-on. Wow, fantastic ball-striking. Counter-attacking cricket
138 kph, an easy single. Full outside off, pushed to cover. Pandya comes in Dickwella's way as he completes the run. Pandya ain't too happy, nor is Dickwella
short and wide outside off, slashed to deep cover. Umesh makes contact with the boundary and the ball at the same point, at the boundary. Another boundary
floated up on leg stump, hint of turn, Dickwella sits back and works the ball defensively to midwicket
slower and fuller on middle, a sweep-happy Dickwella secures a single to fine leg. Paddled away. SL bring up 100 in 21 overs. Kohli had called it a high-risk shot. It looks good when it comes off

And it looks ugly when it doesn't come off. Dickwella ventures another high-risk shot and sees himself get stumped! Looped up higher - this is the googly - Dickwella forays down the track and aims to launch it down the ground or possibly over the leg side. The ball breaks back in with bounce, sneaks through the gate, Saha moves nimbly to his right and whips the bails off without any fuss
pushed through and sliding across the crease-bound prod of Perera
lobbed up, really full on off, this time Perera presses forward and smothers it back to Kuldeep
even fuller on the legs, clipped away straight to short midwicket
good length and holds its line in the channel, Chandimal does not go after it
he hits 140ks and finds seam movement! Back of a length and swerves in, hunting for the top of off, Chandimal's bat intervenes
speared fuller on a fifth-stump line, Chandimal covers his off stump carefully and lets it go

even fuller and keeps low in the channel, left alone again. Saha endures an unkind bounce and believe it or not the ball beats him! Four byes against his name. The ball rolls away to the boundary behind
on a length and outside off, Chandimal takes it on the up and drives the ball to mid-off
back of a length on off, Chandimal uses the bowler's angle to his advantage and simply tucks the ball behind square on the leg side

Dilruwan Perera pulls a rank half-tracker straight into the lap of Pandya at deep midwicket - the only man on the leg-side boundary. What a banner day for Pandya. A maiden Test ton, the wicket of Mathews, and a catch to boot. This was darted on middle, deserved to be smacked over the boundary. Instead, Perera picks out the fielder. You can't get away from Pandya
tossed on middle, defended
sliding across off, Pushpakumara plays with soft hands and edges it past slip
Chandimal deploys a long stride and defends it with the break to short leg
this skids on off stump, full in length, presses forward again and defends
shorter and spins away outside off, Chandimal uses the depth of the crease and punches it away past the left of Ashwin at mid-off
slower offbreak, starts on a fourth-stump line, and turns in, defended on the front foot. Will keep short leg interested
another loopier offbreak, defended to short leg
hung up higher, Pushpakumara shimmies out, but this ball dips, and catches the pad. He was nowhere close to the pitch
turn and bounce, off the thigh pad and pops up to short leg
pushed through fuller on off stump, inside-edged onto the front pad
tossed up on off stump, presses forward and replies with a dead bat
on a length and sliding across off from over the wicket, defended on the front foot
even fuller and outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off, where Ashwin is deeper than normal
tossed up on off and turns away past the outside edge. Pushpakumara did well not to thrust his hands at that wrong'un
slid outside off from wide of the crease, left alone
another googly! Pushpakumara has no clue about this. He plays for the one that breaks in. Tossed up and curves away outside off, he plays inside the line and allows himself to get beaten
this one turns into him, from a length, and Pushpakumara has no problems in glancing the ball behind square. Chandimal turns down the single
length-ball offbreak, clipped with the spin to the right of short midwicket
tossed up slower and higher, hint of turn again, deflected to short leg on the bounce

a big appeal for caught behind. Did the glance the glove on its way? Saha and India think so. Umpire Tucker had shot down the appeal. India challenge the on-field not-out decision. Replays confirm there was no bat or glove involved. The ball bounced over the low hands and the bat. 'Clear daylight, and am happy there is no contact between bat and ball,' says TV umpire Illingworth
pushed through flatter and quicker, played back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, prodded into the covers
Chandimal goes low again for a sweep, this time there isn't extra bounce to trouble him and he doesn't play early. Rolls his wrists and directs the ball through backward square leg. Well played
pitches on middle stump and breaks just past the leg stump. Chandimal sweeps far too early again
tossed up slower and on off, squirts an inside edge to square leg. He takes the single and trusts Malinda against Kuldeep
wide of the crease, slid in on off, Malinda pokes it to cover-point
whipped from outside off to the left of short midwicket
lobbed up full on middle, Chandimal eyes up a big drive, checks his shot and taps it back to the bowler
skids into the leg stump, or even outside, just too full for the sweep. Chandimal dares to attempt that shot but does not make contact again
good take by Saha. Flat down leg, well down leg. Beats Pushpakumara's sweep
that's a lovely stroke. Short and wide outside off, spinning back in. Pushpakumara lets the ball spin before cutting late, a very very late cut to the third man boundary
quick on the pads, worked to midwicket
quicker outside off, more drift. Defended easily enough
defended towards cover
goes wider of the crease, tossed up on leg, beats Pushpakumara on the inside edge, struck on the pad. An appeal is quickly shot down
flight on off, defended away
overly full outside off, Chandimal's drive jams back to the bowler
slow and short on off, a thick leading edge towards cover.
prodigious spin. Pushpakumara thrusts his hands and bat behind the front pad, allowing the ball to spin back and beat the outside edge
skewed away towards midwicket
