more flight outside off, defended away by Pushpakumara, who gets right forward to keep it out
81 kph, flat delivery on off, Chandimal misses a flick and is struck right in front of off. Umpire Tucker says no to Ashwin's appeals
a carrom ball on middle and leg, defended
another very readable carrom ball, defended away easily enough
another carrom ball down leg, off the pad
the quicker slider on off, kept out
an easy nudge to deep square leg for a single. Retains the strike
quick outside off, spin back in, pushed back with the spin to the bowler
the googly outside off, defended away to cover
wristily whipped to deep midwicket
he's nailed the sweep. Flat on leg, the googly. Pushpkumara creams his sweep to the deep square leg boundary
shapes for another sweep, but bails out, drives back
quick on leg, Pushpakumara tries to pull that but is beaten for pace. Struck on the thigh pad after hitting the glove. An appeal, no says the umpire. Sliding down.
tossed up outside off, Chandimal defends comfortably
another carrom ball, on leg, worked to midwicket

worked straight into the hands of leg gully. Plenty of flight outside off from Ashwin, spins back in. Chandimal sees that flight and complacently tries to work that into the leg side, but the ball takes the inside half of the bat, ricochets into the pad and then to leg gully. A soft dismissal.
elegantly worked to midwicket with the spin
an overpitched straight carrom ball is kept out
invites a drive with plenty of flight outside off, skewed away to midwicket
plenty of flight outside off, defended towards cover. No, says Pushpakumara. A long run

that's great captaincy by Kohli. Brought in silly point for that ball, Kuldeep tossed up a googly on middle. Pushpakumara could not help himself from attempting an exuberant cover drive into the vacant cover region. Misses the ball by a considerable distance and the ball hits the stumps. Crowded out.
flat outside off, spins back in and almost goes through a big gap between bat and pad. Inside edge
on the pads, played away towards short leg
nicely bowled. Plenty of flight outside off, inviting the drive. Miscued back to the bowler
capably defended in front of his eyes. Another wicket maiden
flight outside off, defended
the quicker dart outside off, Sandakan defends back
short and wide, sees width and he tries to cut but beaten by bounce
slow on off, defended back
on the pads, nudged away to deep midwicket.
74 kph, slow on the pads, beats Fernando on the inside edge and pops up to silly point. Not off the bat.
tossed up outside off, another defensive block
nicely defended, right over the ball
driven up to mid-off, no run
the googly on middle and off, Sandakan goes back and defends capably enough
clipped to short leg from the back foot
worked away through square leg for a run. Plenty of flight on that
juuust over mid-on. But good intent. Gets to the pitch and lofts it over mid-on, hit with the spin.
drifts down leg, starts it outside off, Sandakan misses a defensive stroke
50 mph, another carrom ball, pushed back
another nice lofted stroke. Gets close to the pitch and hits over the bowler this time. Not great timing but good placement, earns four
clipped away to square leg
the legspinner, just too full outside off, gets underneath the bat.
just short of slip. A googly on middle and leg, Vishwa jabs at it, gets a thick outside edge which lands in front of Rahane
this is the legbreak outside off, goes through a big gap between bat and pad
driven into silly point's feet
the googly down leg, defended

gone through bat and pad, and ricochets into the stumps via the pad. Lots of flight on leg and middle, the ball spins back in. Fernando doesn't have an idea of which way the ball is spinning (there were two googlies and two legbreaks before this ball in the over), and finds a big enough gap. Another fine wristspinning performance in international cricket. Teams have to know by now that a wristspinner is a match-changing option in all formats.
the googly outside off, defended away
quick on middle and leg, defended
82 kph, more variation, the carrom ball outside off, defended
flight on middle, Sandakan wants to send this into tomorrow but gets a thick inside edge into his pad
and that's the end of the innings. Flat on middle and leg, Sandakan gets a thick inside edge into his pad and goes to leg gully. Another soft dismissal.
a nice positive stride, pushes to mid-off.
too straight from Shami, worked through backward square leg for a couple
too straight from Shami, flicked away merrily through midwicket. Not a great start from Shami. starting his inswingers too straight
very close. Struck just outside the line? Full delivery, seaming back in, towards off. That's very close. Karunaratne falls over during his flick. Inside edge onto the pad
full and very wide outside off, left alone
good end. 131 kph, on a length outside off, seam movement back in, left alone
quick and straight, skids on, defended
straight, slightly shorter, worked to mid-on
more drift back in to the batsman who defends
more flight on off, Tharanga gets forward to defend
quick and straight, no turn whatsoever. Defended
there's plenty of flight on that, outside off. Tharanga leans on a crisp cover drive. Fine stroke.
full delivery outside off, rather wide. Leave-able. But Karunaratne drives, hit back to the bowler

smashed on the neck. That's very nasty. A very well-directed bouncer, keeps following Karunaratne with some inswing. He ducks into the ball, eyes off it. The ball goes on and hits him on the shoulder blade. The physio needs a look. Serious discomfort. Extremely unfortunate, not what SL need
no, he goes with another bouncer. 142 kph. When he has bowled short, it's been with intent. Gets underneath this time
full outside off, left alone. More seam movement back in
more good bowling. Starts this outside off, swinging back in, left alone
good length outside off, defended. 138 kph
too full, on the pads, pushed to mid-on
quick and straight, blocked back
slow on the pads, worked away to short leg
more flight and loop outside off, driven to short cover. Just a hint of turn
slider outside off, quick, defended
nice end. Another maiden. Slow on off, Tharanga gets forward to defend
good length outside off, seam movement back in, pushed to mid-on
this is the one that got Karunaratne in the first innings. Good length outside off, comes back in but not as much as some others have. Left this time
brings this back in on a length, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, Karunaratne sways out the line. Well bowled
the late inducker. Full and straight, worked to square leg
good length outside off, punched towards cover from the back foot. Three consecutive maidens
flat on the pads, a thick inside edge towards midwicket
slowed up outside off nicely, Tharanga plays the line and allows himself to be beaten. Good defensive technique
defended off the front foot
quicker and fuller on the pads, worked into the leg side
slightly shorter, extracts some turn, outside off, pushed to cover. Opened him up slightly
darts this one on off, Tharanga is squared up as he defends to point
83 mph, full and straight, defended, keeps a touch low
137 kph, Kohli dives to his right to save runs. Good length outside off, punched off the back foot into the cover region
139 kph, starts that wide outside off, bringing the ball back in, left alone
good length outside off, 86 mph, another confident leave
back of a length on off, worked to square leg. India won't mind that, Shami can attack Tharanga and Ashwin Karunaratne
full and far too wide, left alone
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
a big appeal from Saha and Ashwin. flat down leg, Saha completes another terrific take.
lots of flight on leg, driven to mid-off
pushed back to the bowler, too full this over save the second ball
round-arm action, flat on off, gets a thick inside edge into the body
drift and flight on off, Karunaratne gets behind the line to defend
beats the bat first up. On the inside edge. 134 kph. Good length on off and middle, beats Tharanga's flick.
good length around off, 133 kph, defended to mid-on
good length outside off, defended back
lovely shot. Full delivery outside off, driven to Kohli at cover
carved away to the deep point fielder. Full and wide from Umesh. Not getting much seam movement
on the pads, worked to square leg. 86 mph
quick and straight, defended
slow outside off, defended off the front foot.
80 kph, outside off, skewed to point
the carrom ball outside off, 76 kph, driven to cover
too full from Ashwin on off, pushed to mid-off.
flat on leg, inside-edged towards mid-on
good length outside off, Tharanga stays back, lets the ball come to him and then deflects the ball to deep point. Well played.
shovelled with that inswinging angle towards midwicket
back of a length, straying down leg. An ODI wide. Not a bad surprise option, have a batsman strangled down the leg side

chopped on! Tharanga has a defeated look on his face. Good length outside off, Tharanga plays away from the body, his feet stuck in the crease, possibly due to the length of the ball or some weariness or some complacency. Either way, the ball takes the inside edge and knocks into off stump. A 45-degree bat to a ball seaming back in - how much ever it moves - is a dangerous option fraught with risk. Not the first time it's happened to Tharanga this series.
full and straight, defended into the leg side
good length delivery outside off, no feet movement to a ball that seams away. Pushpakumara plays inside the line or is beaten by a mile.
a full toss on the pads, flicked to midwicket. Should have been put away
shortish outside off, punched into the body of silly point
these are all risky shots. Flat and quick on off, under-edged away towards point
the googly outside off, capably defended
it's a risky shot but he gets it away nicely. Short and wide from Kuldeep, crashed through point for four. Stayed low
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off. He tried but won't prevent another over
slow outside off, defended
the topspinner outside off, a little bit of turn back in. Eyes on the ball as he defends
on the pads, may have been the slider or the carrom ball, off the pad towards short leg
looped up over the batsman's eyeline, blocked
more flight outside off., staunch defense with the head over the ball, eyes on it
the legbreak on middle and off, Pushpakumara picks the variation, goes back and defends it back
flight outside off to start, Karunaratne strides forward and blocks
slightly shorter and Karunaratne goes back, slices a cut to backward point
fine shot, the first boundary of the day. A bit leg side-ish and flicked merrily through midwicket. Full enough to smother the spin, no trouble
that's quicker through the air and full, driven to cover with the direction of spin
read him off the hand. Slow outside off, not too full but Karunaratne lets it go
doesn't quite read that. Flat on leg, the googly on leg, beats Karunaratne on the inside edge, struck on the pad, but going down
138 kph, beaten for pace. Full delivery on middle, hit the seam and ducked back in to beat the inside edge. Strikes Pushpakumara on the pad,  but going down again.
there's byes. Missed his line there, sliding down leg, and the movement takes it further down so much so that even Saha can't collect cleanly
good length around off, defended solidly enough
beauty. 142 kph, full delivery outside off, those previous deliveries force the night watchman to play but the ball holds its line and beats the bat. A jaffa
142 kph, dragged that back slightly and Pushpakumara stays back, pushes to mid-off. Hurried for pace
goes for the inswinging yorker on off, seaming back in. Pushed away to mid-off. A no-ball called, doesn't look like he overstepped though.
goes slightly wide of the crease. Very subtle but makes a big difference at this level. Pitches outside off, forcing Pushpakumara to play and the ball leaves him. Another good over to start
flight outside off, full enough for the spin to be smothered with a nice gentle forward press
beaut! Flight on off and middle, draws Karunaratne into a forward defensive stroke but some ripping turn takes the ball past the outside edge. That will put some doubt

and the wicket. Another terrific delivery. Flat and quick outside off, Karunaratne has no idea if it's the slider or the one that turns. His feet are nowhere and he fiddles at the ball, chases after the turn and gets some glove/shoulder of the bat on it. Easily snaffled up by slip. He could have played that better, just played the line, but that's easier to say than play. A deserved wicket for Ashwin, did him in with that previous delivery too. The pace was good too, he didn't let Karunaratne come forward or go back decisively
the drifter, slides on towards middle. Mendis worried about the turn , opens up a big gap between bat and pad. Defended awkwardly
flight on middle, this one turns, beats the inside edge and hits the pad on the way up. Short leg takes it. No glove or bat
another slider outside off, comfortably defended this time
142 kph, full and straight, hit back to the bowler, who fires the ball back (at the stumps) but misses
well bowled. Full and straight, meets Pushpakumara's defensive block
wide of the crease again, bowls this full towards off, defended towards point
back of a length down leg, off the glove to leg gully. That's a terrific length to use sparingly
139 kph, his feet are rooted to the crease. Good length delivery outside off, beats the outside edge. The benefits of that previous delivery
137 kph, cracked away from the crease towards point. Pandya sticks his right hand out to save some runs.
played that well. Saw the ball onto the bat, and played it down towards leg gully
quicker and flat on leg, Mendis bent his knees, stayed back, and then just used the angle to swivel-pull over square leg. Terrific shot
quick and flat outside off, defended off the back foot
slower on middle, some turn, played into the leg side
53 mph, the arm ball, may have moved away slightly, blocked into the off side
a couple for Mendis. Too many variations from Ashwin, pushed into the off side, through cover
back of a length on middle and leg, defended away easily.
full outside off, wide of the crease again, Pushpakumara sees a gleaning gap at cover and asks himself if he can find it, but the ball just holds its line and leaves the bat
142 kph, full around off, thick outside edge towards gully. Dies in front of the fielder but good stop
well bowled. Full and straight, Pushpakumara defends back solidly
139 kph, on a length around leg, blocked solidly. A decent defensive technique, perfect night watchman
134 kph, full outside off, driven through cover
50 mph, flat outside off, Mendis gets outside the line and sweeps to the deep square leg fielder
very slow outside off, but not full enough to entice a drive. Watchfully defended
flat on leg, off the pad to short leg
84 kph, quick outside off, outside-edged towards third man to get off the mark off his 30th delivery
nicely bowled, the topspinner with some loop on leg and middle, carefully played away
too full, may have been the slider again, pushed back
good length around off, inside-edged into the pad

goes wide of the crease again, full delivery around off. That angle forces Pushpakumara into a defensive prod, but the ball doesn't come back in, like the batsman plays for. It holds its line, gets a thick outside edge and is comfortably taken by Saha.
well bowled. Uses the bouncer well. Aimed at the badge, Chandimal ducks underneath
142 kph, fullish, around off, defended towards point. There isn't much movement, but there needn't be too much to get wickets
full and straight again, solidly behind the line to defend
fantastic bowling. Chandimal forced to play through that over. Full around off, blocked. From that line and length, a little bit of movement either way is lethal
an ODI wide, 86 kph, flat down leg, good take by Saha
slow outside off, 73 kph, Mendis can't get to the pitch, worked to midwicket
quick outside off, blocked
looking for the sweep, but the length is short so even though he thinks he has time, he is forced to improvise. A half-stabbed pull past short leg
quick outside off, defended
the delivery point is changed, goes higher than normal. Trying to extract more bounce. Gets some but Chandimal is behind the line
on a length on the pads, worked to square leg
that line again, on off, fullish length, blocked
fuller delivery outside off, driven away comfortably to mid-off
141 kph, a bit of width from Shami and Mendis climbs all over it. A flashing cut along the ground beats point

full, straight and given! No review from Mendis. Sri Lanka tottering. Beaten for pace. Goes full on leg, Mendis misses a flick, and you just can't miss straight deliveries. Umpire Tucker's finger goes up almost instantaneously. Umpire's call? Sliding down? A straight midwicket meant Mendis tried to use as less of the bat as possible, to hit the ball through square leg. To make that possible, he uses a cross-ish bat. Umpire's call on HawkEye, clipping by the slimmest of margins.

143 kph, Mathews is expecting the bouncer or the straight delivery, but it's just a good length outside off. It's lethal because Mathews thinks he has to play. The ball just beats the outside edge. Another terrific over from Shami.
quick outside off, defended well by Chandimal
the carrom ball? Full outside off, pushed to mid-off for a tight, but good single
lots of flight outside off, defended
short and wide, spinning back in, slashed through cover for a run
slow and loopy on leg, off the pad towards short leg
uses that bouncer again, 146 kph, Mathews ducks under
89 mph, full and straight, Mathews forced to play again, defended
in the gap through the gully region for four. Mathews flirts, the ball kisses the outside edge and flies through the gap between third slip and gully. All along the ground.
full and wide outside off, the drive-enticer. Mathews says not yet, left alone
wide of the crease, on the pads, flicked through square leg for a couple. Just a bit leg side-ish
worked away through square leg for a couple more. On a length on middle, flicked neatly through that gap
flight outside off, the length is not full enough to block, it spins back in and beats Chandimal on the inside edge. Struck on the body
flat on off, Chandimal misses a sweep. Ump Illingworth says no to India's query. May have been just outside the line, some glove too.
swept to the deep backward square leg fielder
flat and quick outside off, pushed towards cover for a run
83 kph, another big appeal. No again. Ashwin says no to the review. Flat outside off, Chandimal misses another sweep. Just outside the line again?
use of the feet, gets to the pitch and pushes to mid-on
fullish outside off, neatly driven towards mid-off for a couple. Vacant mid-off region
full and wide outside off, left alone. A bit of away shape
full delivery outside off, pushed to that short mid-off fielder
gets close to the pitch and pushes the ball towards cover, with the bat and pad close together
140 kph, overpitched and straight, flicked to mid-on
good end. Full outside off, a couple stumps outside off. Left alone
on middle and leg, strays down leg. Good take by Saha
quick outside off, defended to point
lovely shot. Short outside off, Chandimal goes right back and punches through cover. Riskless stroke. Great execution, good footwork too
on the pads, flicked to midwicket with the spin
plenty of flight on that, full around off, pushed away to mid-on
overpitched delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
on a length around off, just outside, defended back
terrific line, close to off, defended back easily enough
142 kph, full delivery outside off, wide of the crease, defended towards mid-off
a solid block by Mathews into the cover region
full delivery outside off, swerving back in, left alone. Moves after beating the bat, Saha dives to his left
quick on the pads, clipped to short leg
nice and slow outside off, Chandimal watchfully defends
73 kph, slow on off, thick inside edge to gully as Chandimal looks to flick
that's a risky shot. Gets inside the line and drives against the spin, towards cover.
plenty of flight and loop on leg, off the pad to short leg. An appeal, but just pad on that
use of the feet, gets to the pitch and drives to a deepish mid-on
good length outside off, tapped away to backward point
fullish delivery outside off, a nice leave
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off. No seam movement
140 kph, full around off, driven to mid-on. The storm seems to have been weathered
good length outside off, defended to cover
overpitched on off, 140 kph, nudged to mid-on. A tidy maiden
nicely played. 51 mph, shortish on leg and middle, flicked powerfully to deep midwicket. Let the ball come to him
slow outside off, spins back in, played into the leg side
a very full delivery is swept away to deep backward square leg
the carrom ball outside off, skewed off the outside half to point for a tight run
short and quick on the pads, nudged to deep backward square leg. Playing Ashwin well these two
83 kph, short on middle and off, tucked away past silly point for a run to deep square leg
full delivery outside off, too wide to draw a stroke. Left alone
a thick edge which lands well in front of Kohli at third slip. Got just enough away movement there
wide enough to be left alone. The length is nice - fuller than a good length
excellent option. Surprising the batsman because there ain't no fine leg. Short down leg, Chandimal pulls out of his flick late
good length around off, defended to mid-on. Solidly behind the line

a half-volley outside off, Chandimal strides forward and transfers that forward momentum into the ball. His timing and placement is excellent, those are all the requisites you need for a boundary. A crisp cover drive through wide mid-off
flight outside off, smothered away
shortish and straight from around the wicket, clipped to short leg
sees Mathews coming and shortens the length and quickens the pace, defended
54 mph. Flight outside off, Mathews looks to go over mid-on but doesn't get to the pitch. Skewed to Rahul's right at short leg. Hits his pad, more than anything.
pushed into the off side, towards cover
short down leg, clipped to deep backward square leg
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off from the crease
good length outside off, a hint of seam movement back in, pushed back to the bowler
full and straight, 141 kph, worked away to square leg. Probing but not overly penetrative from Umesh
full and wide, left alone, 141 kph

132 kph, some of India's fielders go up. Not all. Kohli thinks and thinks and reviews. Good length delivery outside off, a wafty flirt from Mathews. The ball leaves him late, there is a noise as the ball leaves bat. 'There's daylight,' says the third umpire. There is indeed. 'A tiny noise there,' also says the third umpire. There's no discernible spike, certainly no heartbeat. 'I got nothing conclusive to overturn the on-field decision,' says the third umpire Oxenford. Right decision in the end
full, wide and left alone
full and wide outside off, 80 mph, left alone
overpitched delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
well bowled. Gets that to jag back in, towards middle and off, clipped to square leg
full delivery outside off, driven to mid-off again
130 kph, nudged towards midwicket for a run
wide of the crease, seaming back in on a good length, defended to mid-on for a quick, but well-judged run
slow outside off, spinning back in, defended
quick on middle and leg, not much turn, worked to short leg
nicely bowled, some flight, slow pace, straight. Defended equally capably
turns down leg, clipped to square leg
on the pads again, easily negated with a nudge into the leg side
plenty of flight on leg, couldn't see if it was a googly or stock ball, that's how full it was
not yet, full and wide outside off, defended to cover
full and straight, clipped to short midwicket
good length around off, defended to mid-on
nice line. Just around off, but no movement so easily defended from the front foot
a yorker outside off, jammed out
nicely driven to mid-off. Some nip back in, but easily played
the googly on leg and middle, played into the cover region
flat and straight, beats Mathews on the inside edge. An appeal, no says ump Tucker. Sliding well down
a googly outside off, Mathews plays him off the pitch, going back to defend
quick on middle and leg, off the pad towards short leg
getting plenty of turn, pitches on off, but spins down leg. Mathews bails out of a tuck
flat outside off, blocked
strays down leg, an ODI wide. Chandimal misses out on four
135 kph, good length outside off, defended towards cover
on a length on middle, worked to midwicket
wow, that was wide. A swinging delivery welllll down leg. A great diving collection from Saha.
106 kph, the legbreak googly outside off, left alone
no fine leg there. Back of a length on middle and leg, pulled to fine leg. Not a bad option from Umesh or Chandimal
flight on off, defended easily
tripe from Kuldeep, happens often with wristspinners, pulled to backward square leg
50 mph, a low full toss on middle, swept to square leg for a single
nudged towards midwicket for another well-judged run
a low full toss on off, pushed back to the bowler
plenty of flight outside off from around the wicket, Mathews reaches out and drives back to the bowler
137 kph, good length delivery, some movement away. Fiddled away to cover
full and wide outside off, 138 kph, no stroke
squared him up. Terrific delivery, full around off, moves away late. Chandimal isn't sure of the direction of swing, somehow ekes this out
full and straight, nagging away, 87 mph, kept out
back of a length outside off, 135 kph, another solid defensive block
136 kph, full and straight, worked away to midwicket. That'll be lunch
tossed up liberally and full outside off, Chandimal stretches out and drives the ball to cover
hint of turn and bounce, but finishes on leg or even outside, deflected to where leg slip may have been
length ball, spins into the thigh, Chandimal skips back and clips it away to backward square leg
skids on off stump, and turns away - googly - Chandimal presses forward and smothers it
Chandimal gets forward and defends with the spin to short leg on the bounce
much flatter and faster, heading towards the stumps, Chandimal squeezes it out
slow, full offbreak, blocked to short leg from the crease
oooh! Mathews forays down the track and aims to smite it over midwicket. But this one dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Drags it over the fielder off a thick inside edge
full and straight, clipped away past the right of mid-on
tossed-up offbreak, Ashwin finds extra bounce again, lobs off the thigh pad, Pujara at short leg stretches his right hand and takes it. But no bat involved
pushed through and drifts away outside off, takes the outside edge and rolls past slip
Mathews steps out again, he is beaten in flight again, he may have eked out an inside edge onto the front pad
tossed up on leg stump and turns away, wrong'un, Chandimal reads it and answers with a dead bat
mighty full on off, Chandimal jabs it straight to mid-on
fuller on leg stump, defended to short leg
full and slides across off, Chandimal deploys a long stride and keeps it out
much slower and dips on off, Chandimal defends it with a straight bat
full and straight, Chandimal presses forward and drives it straight to mid-on
pushed through full just a shade outside off, Mathews nails a sweep but short midwicket flings to his right to intercept the ball
legbreak? Nope, carrom ball, full, drifts in, and curves away, poked to cover
full and straight, Mathews drives it straight to mid-on
short offbreak, Mathews ventures deep in the crease and whips it behind square

an inside edge lobs to the left of Pujara at forward short leg. Tossed up and spins in, Chandimal presses forward, but is dips, and the batsman ekes out an inside edge onto the pad. Chandimal gets away
faster and flatter, attacking the stumps, Mathews keeps it out
flighted on middle and leg, presses forward and blocks to short leg
Chandimal steps out, gets too close to the pitch, can't get any elevation. So, jams it out to cover
Chandimal races down the track again, takes this full ball from outside off and drills it to Rahul at short cover, who has to endure an unkind bounce
looks like a wrong'un, starts on leg stump and breaks towards middle, Mathews reads it, goes back and defends watchfully
Mathews shows his ace early. He shimmies out. Kuldeep is wary of it as he pulls his length back and hits the pad. Mathews was a long way down the pitch
Mathews uses his feet again, takes it on the full and hits it straight to mid-on
Chandimal skips out now, this offbreak hits his front pad as he is beaten in flight. Chandimal is a long way down the pitch. It was spinning down leg too
carrom ball, poked to cover
slower through the air on off, breaks in, Chandimal uses his feet but does not meet the pitch. Miscues it to the leg side
looped up outside off, Chandimal forays down the track again. He knows mid-off up is up. He carves it over that fielder. Not off the middle
Mathews continues to use his feet, he gets too close to the pitch. Toe-ended back to the bowler
straighter one outside off, Mathews plays inside the line of it, searching for turn, and is beaten
flatter and quicker on off, defended back to Kuldeep
Bam! Mathews forays down the track again, makes sweet connection now. Takes it on the full and dumps the ball over the bowler's head for a clean six
short and turns in, whipped away on the back foot to square leg
Chandimal allows this full ball to spin into him, then picks it from middle and works it to backward square leg
slides on outside off, Mathews stretches out for a sweep but misses, and is pinned on the front pad. He is hit outside the line off
uses his feet and pushes it back to Ashwin
length-ball offbreak, grazes the pad and rolls to short leg
skiddy offbreak, short, punched off the back foot to the right of midwicket
flatter and shorter on off as he sees Chandimal skip out. Defended back to him
Chandimal ventures down the track, takes a full ball from middle and drives it just wide of mid-on for one. This is Sri Lanka's best partnership in the match by the way
floated up on leg stump and spins down the leg side, beating the glance
slides on middle, clipped off the back foot to square leg

Chandimal lobs it into the lap of Pujara at short leg. Kuldeep shortens his length, turns in, stock ball again. Chandimal reads the length and goes right on the back foot. But jams the ball onto the flap of the pad, aiming to work it away over the leg side. Pujara pouches it safely. India are just five steps away from 3-0
brings out the sweep right away. Goes low but the ball bounces over the bat, hits the shoulder on its way to the keeper
looped up and turns away outside off. Dickwella - who had aimed for the sweep initially - changes his mind and misses a drive in the channel
on a length and spins away outside off, pushed with the spin to point
offbreak, jumps  off the surface, lobs off the pad to short leg
tossed up on off, Mathews stretches forward to smother it
looped up on off and curves away, carrom ball Mathews presses forward and drives it solidly to mid-off
tossed up on off, defended
pushed through outside off, safe line and the length is right for the sweep as well. Mathews rolls his wrists and sends the ball to deep square leg
full on middle, Dickwella doesn't mind sweeping from the stumps. Controls it well enough. Paddles a single to long leg
darted short and spinning down leg, Mathews waits for the ball to break down leg. Then swats it away fine to the left of Saha
shorter and speared on off, Mathews stands tall and forces a single down to long-on
looped up wide outside off and spins away further, Dickwella chooses to let this pass though he loves bat on ball
wrong'un, spins in on off, defended
pushed through on off stump, Dickwella drops down to one knee and nails a sweep over square leg. There is no protection there
tossed up slower on middle, Dickwella goes much finer. Paddled to long leg
Mathews feigns to step out, Ashwin fires it shorter, Mathews pads up to it
flat offbreak on off, hangs back and whips to midwicket
length ball, starts outside off and breaks in, defended with the spin to short leg
full on off, Mathews presses out and pats it defensively to midwicket
slow, slow, drifting down leg. Mathews lines up for a biiiig club but can't make contact

an appeal for leg-before. Umpire Illingworth raises his finger. Mathews chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. Did he get bat onto it? Replays suggest that there's no bat involved. The impact is in line and the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. TV umpire Oxenford upholds the on-field decision. Mathews dares to sweep from the stumps and does not make contact again. This was pushed through faster and fuller, he was pinned in front of middle
flighted on off, stretches out in defence
tossed up and turns outside off, flashes an outside edge to point
pushed through on the leg stump, Dickwella unleashes a flat, hard sweep and sends the ball away to the left of deep midwicket
tossed up slower and higher on middle, defended back
full on off, defended back off the front foot
straight ball just outside off, Perera aims for an expansive drive and ends up squirting an inside edge past leg stump
length-ball offbreak, defended with soft hands to short leg
tossed up, turns in, bounces to beat the inside edge and hit the flap of the front pad outside off
defended with spin to short leg
length-ball offbreak, defended back

Dilruwan has been given out caught behind. He calls for a review. Even if it did not clip the inside edge Dilruwan could be out lbw. There seems to be a deflection but Ultra Edge does not throw up a spike as the ball loops up to slip. The TV umpire checks for the leg before as well. But the tracker shows the ball was doing too much - heading past leg
worked behind square with the spin
half-tracker on middle, Perera smacks it along the ground to the right of short leg who was in the firing line
short, wide, bang. Slow turn outside off, Dickwella goes deep in the crease and crashes the ball to the cover boundary
much fuller and spins away outside off, Dickwella swishes again through the covers
on a length and spins away outside off, slashed to the right of Umesh at deep point
full on leg stump, defended wide of short leg
full and spins in on middle, Perera plays back and defends to short leg
on a length and outside off, Dickwella paddles a single to long leg
slower through the air and breaking down leg, Perera can't connect
quicker offbreak, finishes on off, kept out

tossed-up slower and higher, Dilruwan can't resist the temptation to ping it down the ground. He charges down the track and swishes. The ball grazes the inside edge, ricochets off the pad and floats down the leg side. It was too big a deflection for Saha to track it down
on a length and spins in, inside-edged onto the pad
looped up outside off, Dickwella had decided to sweep this ball once he woke up this morning. Paddled to fine leg
low full-toss on middle and leg, patted down to mid-on for one
paddled from off stump to fine leg
tossed up on middle and spins in to leg, defended with soft hands to short leg
pushed through on off, Perera presses forward and defends it
pushed through and spins back in sharply to beat the inside edge and rap the pad, but this seemed to be heading down leg
short and very wide outside off, tapped to a deep third man. Strange position for Ashwin
the carrom ball on leg and middle, kept out ably

Dilruwan Perera finds deep midwicket, again. May have been the topspinner outside off, Dilruwan looks for the sweep but the ball gets some extra bounce and takes the leading edge. Pandya has some ground to cover to his right, but does it with time to spare. An awful match for Dilruwan may have ended
the flat quick slider on off, very very full but Dickwella brooms it away to deep midwicket. Another sweep
the offbreak outside off, worked to midwicket
lots of flight outside off, driven away back to the bowler
flat and wide outside off, carved away to point. Clears his front foot
the googly on middle on off, worked to midwicket
the googly outside off, leaves Sandakan. Beaten
flat and straight, defended watchfully under his eyes
tossed up on leg, off the pad and lobs up to short leg. No bat
lots of flight on middle and leg, rips back in and beats the inside edge
the carrom ball outside off, driven to cover
short and very wide outside off, left alone
short and rather wide outside off, cut to point, a short point
swept away to deep backward square leg
overly full outside off, blocked away
inside-edged to short leg. Lands just in front of the fielder. Well bowled, plenty of loop, drawing Sandakan forward
the googly on middle, 48 mph, defended
a low full toss on leg, worked away to deep midwicket for one.
plenty of flight and loop on that, inside-edged towards leg gully
the wrong 'un on off, defended away
gets forward to defend
too short on leg, Sandakan picks the length, rocks back and pulls through square leg. Nicely hit, similar to his first-innings dismissal
slow but short on off, 50 mph, defended to cover
nice shot. Gets low, gets underneath the length and lifts his sweep over square leg. Intentionally played, hit over the fielder
all along the ground to the fielder at square leg goes the sweep
slow and wide outside off, swept to deep midwicket
short and slow outside off, spinning back in, worked to short leg
takes a few steps down the track and drills a mis-timed drive to mid-on with the spin
full delivery outside off from around the wicket, driven away towards cover
fullish length outside off, 135 kph, seaming back in, pushed away to cover. Kept a tad low
well bowled. Goes slightly wider outside off, Dickwella fishes but catches nothing. Beaten on the outside edge
full and wide outside off, sliced away to the deep point fielder
good length on off, Sandakan awkwardly jams that away
a low full toss outside off, edged away to second slip on the bounce. That was flying away. Good stop by Kohli
flat down leg, Dickwella misses a sweep, but Saha doesn't miss his take
swept to deep backward square leg. Giving one away
slow outside off, spinning back in. Sandakan defends nicely in front of his eyes
gets right forward to defend this
very full but Sandakan goes back, awkwardly played out
short outside off, worked to a deepish midwicket. Dickwella is happy where he is
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to point.
nicely punched through cover. Gives himself some room, gets a length delivery and hits that away through cover. No one there in the deep
good length outside off, 143 kph, Dickwella goes back and misses a cut. Clearing his front leg
144 kph, full and straight. Big appeal, but no says umpre Tucker. Dickwella misses a flick, and is hit on the pad. Sliding down
on a length on leg, pushed to mid-on
a wide yorker outside off, jammed out
strays down leg for an ODI wide
on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg. Refuses the single
cuts that off the stump. Fuller than a good length on off, seaming back in. Dickwella somehow gets bat on that, finds gully
an offcutter on middle, hit towards cover.
drifts down leg again, another ODI wide. Losing his line, starting the inswingers too straight
no one in the deep. Short and wide outside off, Dickwella gets underneath the length and carves the ball over point. Nicely played
drifts down leg, 139 kph. Looking for those ribs. Misses a flick
lovely shot. Backs away and carves a cut in front of point. Got over the bounce too. Nicely executed

144 kph, eight down are Sri Lanka. A touch of width but not nearly short enough to cut. The front foot is cleared, looks for a scythe through point again but gets a thick outside edge. Saha won't drop those. India within two wickets of a series whitewash
full and straight, on the pads, nudged to short leg
full and straight, nicely blocked to the long-on boundary. But Dickwella refuses some runs
full and wide outside off, 147 kph, defended into the off side. Another available run is refused
134 kph, full and straight, cramping Dickwella for room, defended into the leg side
gets forward and carves a cut to point. Pandya prevents two.
a nice short ball, on the ribs, awkwardly fended away to short fine leg
a legbreak outside off, or a googly, sliced to deep backward point

lovely catch by Rahane. India now one wicket away. Terrific reflexes. Full on leg, Dickwella gives himself some room and tries to find the gap either side of gully, but hits it close enough to Rahane, who gets his hands quickly to his left to complete a sensational reflex catch. Opened the bat face. Probably not the best shot selection either, could have gone over square leg, who was up
134 kph, full and straight, defended away
a back-of-a-length lifter outside off, Fernando gets away from the line awkwardly
an offcutter on off and middle, defended back
full on the pads, 144 kph, inside-edged into the pad. Hurried for pace
back of a length down leg, misses the flick. An ODI wide
a flowing punchy drive through mid-off gets Vishwa a couple
good length delivery outside off, 89 mph, a waft at that from Vishwa. Beats the edge
shortish and wide outside off, left alone.
fullish, straight, defended somehow. Ungainly
short of a length down leg, Kumara ducks underneath
smashes him on the arm. Ouch. Another well-directed bouncer on leg, Kumara sways awkwardly, but the ball follows him and thwacks him on the arm.
good length outside off, defended into the off side
on a length on middle and leg, played away towards mid-on. Not the friendliest over to a No. 11
good length on a fourth-stump channel, defended into the off side
a yorker outside off, 145 kph, jammed out back to the bowler
a good softening bouncer on off, 83 mph, Fernando sways out of the line.
dropped! Came back slower than Shami expected. Full delivery outside off, chipped back to the bowler's right. Shami gets his hand out, but the ball hits him on the wrist.
good length outside off, 89 mph, Fernando beaten on the outside edge
142 kph, beaten again. Full outside off, Fernando misses another drive
short and wide outside off, ripping turn. A half leave
the googly outside off, hammered to mid-on
another googly, this is shorter and slower, left alone
smashed away in the gap at mid-off. Plenty of flight outside off, Kumara makes room and hits it well enough
flat and quick outside off, defended
clears mid-on running back. Skips down the track, doesn't get to the pitch but goes through with his attempted slog. Enough bat to clear the fielder running back.
short and slow down leg, worked away to midwicket for a single. Not a result Ashwin would mind
cracked away past mid-on's right. Flight on middle and leg, comes down and drills it back. Not the greatest timing, but enough

and that's the innings! And match! And series! India complete a 3-0 series whitewash. The carrom ball outside off, started it wide enough, the ball beats Kumara on the outside edge and knocks into off stump.
